title: What is the relationship between magnetism and illusions in magic tricks?
first_phrase: This text is an excerpt from a speech on human magnetism by a certain Donato. It argues that human inventions are not mere products of the mind but rather an outcome of combining memories and observations to create something new. The author uses examples such as the "Femme Fakir" and Robert-Houdin's "trick of aerial suspension" to prove the existence of human magnetism. In the last 200 tokens, the author contends that even though fraud and deceit exist, they cannot invalidate the truth. The text concludes with the analogy of condemning counterfeiters, which cannot negate the existence of real gold and silver.

last_phrase: In conclusion, it is essential to acknowledge that the existence of fraudulent practices or fake phenomena does not necessarily invalidate the reality of the genuine ones. As Robert-Houdin and Alfred de Caston have demonstrated, it is possible to be a skilled conjurer and still appreciate the legitimacy of mysterious and inexplicable occurrences. Thus, it is always prudent to approach seemingly inexplicable phenomena with an open mind and a healthy dose of skepticism.
